verses.verse: People should think of us as Christ's assistants and caretakers of the God's mysteries.
Moreover it is required of caretakers that one is found faithful.
But with me it is a very little thing that I should be judged by you or with man's judgment; I don't even judge myself.
For I'm not aware of anything against me, but that doesn't mean I am innocent; he who judges me is the Lord.

Therefore don't make a final decision on anyone before the time, until the Lord comes, who will bring to light both the hidden things of darkness and make clear the motives of the hearts. Then everyone will have praise from God.

These things, brethren, I have by way of illustration applied to Apollos and myself for your sakes, that you might learn from us not to have opinions greater than that which is written, so that no one of you be puffed up one against another.
And who made you so superior and what do you have that you didn't receive [from God]? Now if you did receive it [from God], why do you brag about it as if you didn't receive it [from God]?
Now you are full, now you are rich. You have reigned as kings without us, and oh, that you did reign, so that we could reign with you.
For I think that God has placed us, apostles, lowest, as doomed for death, for we are made a spectacle to the world, angels, and men.
We are fools for the cause of Christ, but you are wise in Christ. We are weak, but you are strong. You are honorable, but we are despised.
Even at this present hour we both hunger and thirst, are dressed in rags, knocked around, and have no certain place to stay.
We work hard, laboring with our own hands. When vilified, we bless. When persecuted, we put up with it.
When publicly slandered, we gently reply. We are made out to be the filth of the world and the scum of everything up to this very day.
I don't write these things to shame you, but I warn you as my beloved sons.
For even though you have ten thousand teachers in Christ, yet you don't have many fathers. For in Christ Jesus I have begotten you through the Gospel.
Therefore I beg you, be imitators of me.
For this reason I sent Timothy to you, who is my beloved son, faithful in the Lord who will help you remember my ways which are in Christ, as I teach everywhere in every congregation.
Now some are swelled up with pride as if I wouldn't come to you.
But I will come to you shortly--if the Lord will--and will check out not the speech of these puffed up people but the power.
For the kingdom of God is not in word but in power.
What do you want? Will I come to you with a rod or in love and the spirit of meekness?
